comment: A bit of smoke at the finish. Reminds me of some scotches. Nice flavor up front so I would drink again. Very smooth and drinkable neat.
Really not worth trying. One of the very few bourbons I ever poured down the drain. Had a very nasty chalkyness to it.
Not too shabby for the cheap price! Strong flavors of caramel and brown sugar. Great as a mixing bourbon, but very drinkable neat.

This cheaper Bourbon is sourced @ bottled by the same folks who source Willet.    It's ok for what it is.

But for cheap bourbon I like Very Old Barton better.

I really enjoy most KBD juice and all iterations....except this one. It's drinkable, but there's something in the flavor profile that's off-putting to my taste buds and nose. Out of balance flavors. Feels hotter than 90 proof.  Probably won't buy again. Will finish the bottle.
Not terrible. Smooth and sweet but not a great aftertaste. Not sure on price as it was a gift.
Surprised at the quality of this, not a lot of depth of flavor but really solid at under $30 from willet.
Ordered Vintage 17 at a bar once and was served this. There are a few small differences between the two. Mostly that this is fairly terrible and V17 causes the clouds to part.
Fresh, grassy nose. Mild on the palate. Feels chalky, thick. Slightly sweet, some floral and herbal notes. Inoffensive.  4/27/18

Without an ice cube, this is more like a 3.0. However, with a cube, this becomes a 3.5 and to my palate, tastes similar to Weller Reserve. Best budget buy right now when you can't find Weller. Pure Kentucky is very similar, and some like it more. The only negative is sometimes I get an aftertaste of sweet and low, but not always.
smokey and oaky this is a solid everyday bourbon at its price point. Nose hints at caramel, corn, rye, its simple and straight forward, buttery and smooth on the palate. long smoke and oak finish.
A customer recommended for my wheat taste, I'm very pleased
Heavy on the sweet side; from a smokey apple and citrusy point of view.
has a weird taste in the middle... like bitter wood, plasticy, artificial taste. finished ok...
Been wanting to try the cheaper willet brands that have come out. For sure not as full flavored as their nicer stuff but great for the lower price point.
Underrated juice. Solid sour mash recipe with all the right notes. Sometimes less is more in the current bourbon world. Cheers!
Pine like raisin smell. Fruity taste. Smooth. Green plant finish. Too fruity to be preferred.

Sweet in the finish. Bold and spicy at the beginning. A little water or cube will bring out the limestone water and sweetness in the end. Really good all around. Almost Canadian in a sense but definitely bourbon
Professional reviewer understates the bitter wood flavor, overpowers the better flavors in this bourbon. Not the worst I’ve tasted, prefer to mix this one.
Floral. Chocolate. Cinnamon. Just a little young.
Peaches on the nose. Heavy and smoky burnt sugar in the mouth with a warmth that lingers.

Cinnamon stick, Cinnamon red hots, oh and Cinnamon!  

Feels and taste more of a 110 proof vs the 90 that’s stated.  Great mouth feel and a tad on the oily side.  Decent finish with a spicy, slightly smoke and wood finish Picked this up by chance for a mere $29 in Myrtle beach.  Over all a decent bargain whiskey, especially if your into cumin?, coriander? clove? .........oh wait CINNAMON!
Spicy nose. Well balanced body. Not overly complex.
Strong smell of wood spice. Finish was vanilla. Great mouthfeel and just overall an interesting bourbon.
Much heavier tobacco nose than anything else I have, I think. Lots of hay and peppery rye on the palate. Quite thin and light in color. Not great, but very drinkable!

I bought this on clearance for 22 bucks and well worth it! I feel that price is fair but much more and it's an easy pass. Very drinkable, nice flavor, but nothing really memorable. A slightly better Benchmark.
Very fragrant nose the oak and caramel jump straight out of the glass. Willett never disappoints.
